data.title: Best practices in Qlik Sense
data.meta_description: The need for best practices in Qlik is to ensure that Qlik applications are well designed, efficient, and provide a good user experience. Best practices are based on years of experience and knowledge…
data.text:
The need for best practices in Qlik is to ensure that Qlik applications are well designed, efficient, and provide a good user experience. Best practices are based on years of experience and knowledge of what works well and what doesn’t work well when designing and developing Qlik applications. By following best practices, Qlik applications can be optimized to provide faster load times, better performance, and more intuitive user interfaces.

Best practices also help to ensure that the Qlik applications are maintainable and scalable over time. A well-designed Qlik application should be able to grow and adapt as new data sources are added and new analysis requirements arise. Following best practices can help to reduce the amount of time and effort required to maintain and update the application over time.

In addition, following best practices can help to ensure that the Qlik application is secure and that sensitive data is protected. This is particularly important when dealing with sensitive data, such as financial data or personal information. By following security best practices, such as using section access, Qlik applications can be protected from unauthorized access and ensure that only the right people have access to the right data.

Here are some best practices in Qlik that can help you optimize your Qlik applications and improve the overall user experience:

Keep data models simple and efficient: Qlik is an in-memory data discovery tool, so it’s important to keep the data models simple and efficient. This means only including the necessary fields and tables for analysis, and avoiding unnecessary data.

Use best practices for data loading: Use optimized load scripts, minimize the number of joins, avoid nested loops, and use the appropriate data modeling techniques. This helps reduce load times and improve performance.

Optimize data modeling: Use proper data modeling techniques like star or snowflake schema based on your data and analysis needs. Use Qlik data model optimization tool to check the performance of your data model.

Use incremental loading: Incremental loading loads only the changed or new data, which reduces the time and effort required to load data. This can be particularly helpful when dealing with large datasets.

Leverage Qlik’s associative model: The associative model allows users to navigate through data in a free-form way, without the need to predefine relationships between tables. This provides a more flexible and intuitive user experience.

Optimize user interface: Design user interfaces that are easy to navigate and use. Keep the design simple and intuitive, with a clear focus on the most important information.

Create reusable objects: Create objects that can be reused across multiple sheets and applications, such as master dimensions, master measures, and charts. This helps to ensure consistency and reduce maintenance.

Use security best practices: Ensure that the right people have access to the right data. Use section access and other security features to protect sensitive data.

Optimize data visualization: Create data visualizations that are easy to read, intuitive, and highlight the most important information. Use appropriate chart types, colors, and labeling to make the information more clear.

Follow documentation best practices: Document your Qlik applications to make it easier for others to understand how the application works and how the data is structured. This can include comments in the load script, documentation for objects and fields, and other relevant information.

As discussed about data models earlier, Here are some best practices you can follow in order to improve app usability.

Use the appropriate data model

Choose the appropriate data model for your specific use case. Star schema and snowflake schema are common data models used in Qlik, and they are optimized for different purposes. Star schema is often best for simpler, more straightforward use cases, while snowflake schema is better for more complex data models.

Minimize the number of tables and fields

Avoid including unnecessary tables and fields in your data model. This can slow down the data load and impact the overall performance of the application. Only include the tables and fields that are required for analysis.

Optimize data loading

Use optimized load scripts to minimize data load time. This includes using the appropriate data modeling techniques, minimizing the number of joins, avoiding nested loops, and using incremental loading wherever possible.

Use the Qlik data model optimization tool

Use Qlik’s data model optimization tool to analyze your data model and identify potential performance bottlenecks. The tool can identify inefficient joins, redundant fields, and other issues that can impact performance.

Optimize field types

Choose the appropriate field type for each field in your data model. For example, use numeric fields for numeric data, and date fields for date data. This can help to optimize queries and improve overall performance.

Avoid circular references

Avoid circular references in your data model, as they can slow down queries and impact performance. Circular references occur when two or more tables are joined in a way that creates a loop.

Optimize the use of synthetic keys

Synthetic keys are created when Qlik detects multiple fields with the same name across multiple tables. While synthetic keys are not inherently bad, they can slow down queries and impact performance. Use the appropriate data modeling techniques to avoid creating synthetic keys where possible.

Use the appropriate aggregation functions

Use the appropriate aggregation functions in your expressions, such as sum() or count(). This can help to optimize queries and improve overall performance.

Optimize the use of set analysis

Set analysis can be a powerful tool for filtering data in Qlik, but it can also impact performance if used improperly. Use the appropriate syntax and avoid using complex expressions where possible.

Monitor and optimize performance

Monitor the performance of your data model and make adjustments as needed. Use Qlik’s performance monitoring tools to identify potential bottlenecks and optimize the data model for better performance.
